question: Which of the following statements is true regarding AWS IAM?

answers.A: An access key is a 30-character alphanumeric key that acts as a user ID.
answers.B: A group is a collection of IAM roles.
answers.C: A group is a collection of IAM users.
answers.D: An access key is a 20-character alphanumeric key that acts as a user ID.
answers.E: A user is a person or an application that requires access to various AWS resources to perform designated tasks
answers.F: Credential policy specifies the complexity requirement of a password and defines the mandatory rotation period for a password associated with IAM users.
